newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire seeks Chinese help for fisheries industry.
newsitem.headline: Zaire seeks Chinese help for fisheries industry.

text.p: Zaire is seeking expert assistance from China to develop its fisheries potential and slash hard currency spending on imports, Zaire's International Cooperation Minister Wivine Nlandu said on Wednesday.

Opening the fifth session of the Zaire-China mixed commission in Kinshasa, Nlandu said despite vast resources from sea and inland waters, Zaire's annual fisheries haul had yet to attain an annual level of 200,000 tonnes.
"Zaire will seek Chinese expertise to reduce progressively the importation of fish which absorbs needlessly a part of our hard currency resources," he said.
Nlandu lauded cooperation between Zaire and China, which he said had not been interrupted since 1973 and had been reinforced by a series of bilateral accords, notably for rice growing.
The fifth session of the mixed commission, which ends on Sunday, follows one in Beijing in 1992.
